#Text=Play with a Sphero 2.0
#Text=A Sphero 2.0 is fun toy for anybody , but it can seem complicated to set up and drive your Sphero .
#Text=This wikiHow will teach you the essentials of using and having fun with your toy .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Setting Up Your Sphero
#Text=Download the Sphero app .
#Text=Open the App Store or Google Play and search for the Sphero app .
#Text=Install it .
#Text=Charge your Sphero .
#Text=Place the Sphero into the charging cradle .
#Text=The light on the base of the charging cradle will begin blinking blue , and turn solid when it is fully charged .
#Text=For more information on charging your Sphero , go to How to Charge the Sphero .
#Text=Wake your Sphero up .
#Text=To wake your Sphero up , double tap with your hand or a hard surface .
#Text=Often it will only respond to tapping on a hard surface - do n't worry about harming it .
#Text=The Sphero will begin flashing colors when successfully woken up .
#Text=Pair your Sphero .
#Text=On iOS , open Settings > General >
#Text=Bluetooth .
#Text=When the Sphero is detected , it will begin to pair with your device .
#Text=On Android , open Settings >
#Text=Wireless Controls >
#Text=Bluetooth .
#Text=When the Sphero is detected , click on its name to begin pairing .
#Text=Open the Sphero app .
#Text=The app will automatically connect with the Sphero each time it is opened .
#Text=Name your Sphero .
#Text=After the app connects with the Sphero , it will open to a screen asking for a name .
#Text=You can always change its name by opening settings in the app ( located on the left side of the circle ) and tapping on the Sphero icon three times .
#Text=This will take you to advanced settings , and at the top of the page you will have to option of renaming it .
#Text=Driving Your Sphero
#Text=Open the Sphero app .
#Text=The app will automatically detect the Sphero .
#Text=Aim your Sphero .
#Text=On the bottom left corner of the controlling screen , you will see a circle with two arrows pointing opposite directions .
#Text=Face the Sphero , then press and hold on this button , and rotate your finger around the circle until the blue tail light is pointed at you .
#Text=Move the Sphero .
#Text=In the center of the screen , there is a control pad with a four-pronged arrow in the middle .
#Text=To move the robot , move the arrow in the direction you wish it to go in .
#Text=You can change the controlling method to tilt by clicking the icon of a phone and two arrows facing different directions on top of it .
#Text=Go on missions .
#Text=Directly to the right of the control pad is a curved rectangle with 3 dots , and a number representing the number of challenges you have , followed by the word " Missions . "

#Text=Click on this for a list of challenges to complete , such as driving your robot a certain distance in a certain amount of time , making sure it does n't crash after it has been " hacked , " even shaking it .
#Text=Doing these challenges will result in level-ups , which grant you cores ( Sphero 's arm of " currency " ) and tricks .
#Text=You can also buy tricks with the cores .
#Text=Level up .
#Text=Above the control pad , a curved bar with a number represents your progress in levels .
#Text=Doing missions will help you level up , as will driving the Sphero around .
#Text=A line of black bars spreading along the level-up bar represents how close you are to leveling up .
#Text=When you have leveled up , the bar will glow white .
#Text=Click to it to receive gifts , but remember that 20 is the max level .
#Text=Perform tricks .
#Text=In the bottom right corner , there will be an icon of a Sphero , though its activity and position varies , with six square dots in two rows at the bottom .
#Text=Click on the dots to scroll through your list of tricks .
#Text=Click on a trick to read its description , then press " Select " .
#Text=To do it , tap on the icon of the Sphero performing the trick .
#Text=Some tricks require the Sphero to move or require the icon to be held down .
#Text=Change your Sphero 's color .
#Text=Beneath the level-up bar directly on the left side , there is a pallet button .
#Text=Press that , then tap the color on the color wheel that you would like .
#Text=When you have chosen a color , click the green arrow in the top left corner .
#Text=Change the speed of your Sphero .
#Text=Situated directly beneath the control pad there is a curved bar , a turtle button on one side , a rabbit button on the other , and a percentage just to the left of the rabbit button .
#Text=Click the turtle button to make the Sphero go slower , and the rabbit button to make it speed up .
#Text=Boost the Sphero .
#Text=Above the trick button , there is a rectangle featuring the Sphero going at high speeds .
#Text=Click on this to make the Sphero temporarily speed up .
#Text=The boost bar will automatically fill up by driving around .
#Text=Go on core drops .
#Text=Just to the right of the speed bar , there is a circle with three plus signs surrounding it .
#Text=Pressing this will enter a mode where you can collect cores by driving around .
#Text=Where the challenges button typically is , there is a new button Sphero icon with a bar a the bottom .
#Text=When you are far away from a core collection , the button will be blue .
#Text=Drive in any direction until the bar begins to become yellow .
#Text=When the bar is green , press the button to ' warp ' and gain cores .
#Text=Your goal is to get as many cores as possible within a time limit .
#Text=The Sphero will rotate and make noises when warped .
#Text=Play other games .
#Text=There are a wide variety of other apps that you can play with the Sphero , available on the App Store and Google Play , such as Color Grab and Chromo Drive .
#Text=There is also an educational app that teaches coding , like Sphero Edu .
